page.title: 09ROAD SAFETY
page.content: Most of today's cyclists have been advised by police that they have to wear clothing that will show up in the dark, and that they will have to have lights on their bikes at night so they can be seen by drivers.Some of the cyclists disobey the police and they just go on the road and give no indication that they are on the road, and that is how accidents happen. To save people getting hurt, each year the police come up to Croy and give us cycling proficiency, they also give out books such as The Highway Code and the Owner's Handbook so that we can learn more about bikes on the road, and how to save other people's lives.In the cycling proficiency the policeman checks all the bikes and sees that they are all secure for taking on the roads.
